TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Deflater extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: This class compresses data using the DEFLATE algorithm (see ).

remarks.para: This class compresses data using the DEFLATE algorithm (see ).
It is usually more convenient to use .

In situations where you don't have all the input in one array (or have so much input that you want to feed it to the deflater in chunks), it's possible to call repeatedly, but you're much better off using to handle all this for you. also helps minimize memory requirementsÂ — the sample code above is very expensive.
Compression levels

A compression level must be to compromise between speed and compression (currently equivalent to level 6), or between 0 (, where the input is simply copied) and 9 (). Level 1 () performs some compression, but with minimal speed overhead.

remarks.para: Constructs a new Deflater instance using the default . The compression strategy can be specified with . A header is added to the output by default; use if you need to omit the header.

Docs.summary: Constructs a new Deflater instance with the given .

remarks.para: Constructs a new Deflater instance with the given . If noHeader is true, no ZLIB header is added to the output. In a zip file, every entry (compressed file) comes with such a header. The strategy can be specified using .

Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

Docs.summary: Returns the checksum of the uncompressed data read so far.

remarks.para: Returns the checksum of the uncompressed data read so far.

Docs.summary: This gives the best compression, but takes the most time.

remarks.para: This gives the best compression, but takes the most time.

Docs.summary: Returns the total number of bytes read by the Deflater.

remarks.para: Returns the total number of bytes read by the Deflater. This method is the same as except that it returns a long value instead of an integer.

Docs.summary: Returns a the total number of bytes written by this Deflater.

remarks.para: Returns a the total number of bytes written by this Deflater. This method is the same as getTotalOut except it returns a long value instead of an integer.

Docs.summary: The default .

remarks.para: The default . This is a trade-off between speed and compression, currently equivalent to level 6.

remarks.para: The default compression strategy.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void End() cil managed

Docs.summary: Frees all resources held onto by this deflating algorithm.

remarks.para: Frees all resources held onto by this deflating algorithm. Any unused input or output is discarded. This method should be called explicitly in order to free native resources as soon as possible. After end() is called, other methods will typically throw IllegalStateException.

Docs.summary: A compression strategy.

remarks.para: A compression strategy.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Finish() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates to the Deflater that all uncompressed input has been provided to it.

remarks.para: Indicates to the Deflater that all uncompressed input has been provided to it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Finished() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns true if has been called and all data provided by has been successfully compressed and consumed by .

remarks.para: Returns true if has been called and all data provided by has been successfully compressed and consumed by .

Docs.summary: Flush buffers so recipients can immediately decode the data sent thus far.

remarks.para: Flush buffers so recipients can immediately decode the data sent thus far. The compression state is also reset to permit random access and recovery for clients who have discarded or damaged their own copy. This mode may degrade compression.

Docs.summary: A compression strategy.

remarks.para: A compression strategy.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool NeedsInput() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns true if must be called before deflation can continue.

remarks.para: Returns true if must be called before deflation can continue. If all uncompressed data has been provided to the Deflater, must be called to ensure the compressed data is output.

Docs.summary: This does no compression.

remarks.para: This does no compression. It is even faster than .

Docs.summary: Use buffering for best compression.

remarks.para: Use buffering for best compression.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Reset() cil managed

Docs.summary: Resets the Deflater to accept new input without affecting any previous compression strategy or level settings.

remarks.para: Resets the Deflater to accept new input without affecting any previous compression strategy or level settings. This operation must be called after returns true if the Deflater is to be reused.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetDictionary(unsigned int8[] dictionary) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the dictionary to be used for compression by this Deflater.

remarks.para: Sets the dictionary to be used for compression by this Deflater. This method can only be called if this Deflater supports the writing of ZLIB headers. This is the default, but can be overridden using .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetLevel(int32 level) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the given to be used when compressing data.

remarks.para: Sets the given to be used when compressing data. This value must be set prior to calling .

Docs.exception: If the compression level is invalid.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetStrategy(int32 strategy) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the compression strategy to be used.

remarks.para: Sets the compression strategy to be used. The strategy must be one of FILTERED, HUFFMAN_ONLY or DEFAULT_STRATEGY. This value must be set prior to calling .

Docs.exception: If the strategy specified is not one of FILTERED, HUFFMAN_ONLY or DEFAULT_STRATEGY.

Docs.summary: Flush buffers so recipients can immediately decode the data sent thus far.

remarks.para: Flush buffers so recipients can immediately decode the data sent thus far. This mode may degrade compression.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: Returns the total number of bytes of input read by this Deflater.

remarks.para: Returns the total number of bytes of input read by this Deflater. This method is limited to 32 bits; use instead.

Docs.summary: Returns the total number of bytes written to the output buffer by this Deflater.

remarks.para: Returns the total number of bytes written to the output buffer by this Deflater. The method is limited to 32 bits; use instead.
